abstract: The AT&T Tilt is shaped like a candy bar has a sliding keyboard, 2.8-inch touchscreen and a processor running at about 400 megahertz.
snippet: The AT&T Tilt is shaped like a candy bar has a sliding keyboard, 2.8-inch touchscreen and a processor running at about 400 megahertz.
lead_paragraph: As phones and computers converge, it is becoming harder to tell them apart. Take the AT&T Tilt, for example. This phone shaped like a candy bar has a sliding keyboard, 2.8-inch touchscreen and a processor running at about 400 megahertz — the speed of many PCs just a few years ago.

headline.main: With a Keyboard and a Pop-Up Screen, Is This a Computer or a Cellphone?
headline.print_headline: With a Keyboard and a Pop-Up Screen, Is This a Computer or a Cellphone?
